basics.name: Alison Chan
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: I'm a mid-level full stack developer who enjoys making shiny, performant, well-tested web apps and the CI/CD workflows that build & deploy them.

work.summary: Full stack web developer with TypeScript, Node, and React
highlights: Implemented new multi-level navigation menu with React and Redux, which enhanced user navigation on the site
Paired with other developers to onboard them and assist in debugging
Implemented health check endpoints and improved caching infrastructure in a Node and hapi.js based middleware
Enforced voting rules on a public-facing web app (https://littlelibraryprize.org) with Firebase Cloud Functions
Created an Ansible playbook to set up a Linux continuous integration worker node
Improved team productivity by creating a CI task to automatically free up worker disk space
Maintained a project's Jenkins CI/CD system
Maintained database workers written in Python

work.summary: Software developer consultant in the insurance industry
highlights: Simplified and improved error handling in Apache Camel-based document integration middleware for an insurance claims system handling 300,000 claims and 2 million documents annually, resulting in fewer system errors, improved performance, and easier troubleshooting
Improved performance and user experience within the constraints of a legacy COTS front end application
Led story-level design review and code review discussions
Worked closely with external vendors and other business departments to troubleshoot production errors

additionalWork.company: What is this week's Torah portion?
additionalWork.summary: (https://github.com/alis0nc/whatisthisweekstorahportion) Microsite which presents information on this week's Torah portion in a minimalist format. Uses the Hebcal API
Head of Logistics for a 1700-member local open source / DIY / science fiction convention
